snippet: The 4.0 magnitude earthquake that struck Youngstown on Saturday occurred at an almost identical location to one a week before, a seismologist who studied the quakes said Monday.
abstract: Earthquake that strikes Youngstown, Ohio, occurs at almost identical location to quake a week before, near bottom of a 9,200-foot-deep disposal well where liquid waste from natural-gas wells had been injected under pressure; findings lend credence to fears that waste from hydraulic fracturing might have migrated to rock formations, allowing ancient fault to slip.
lead_paragraph: The 4.0 magnitude earthquake that struck Youngstown on Saturday occurred at an almost identical location to one a week before, a seismologist who studied the quakes said Monday.

headline.main: Ohio: Sites of Two Earthquakes Nearly Identical
headline.print_headline: Ohio: Sites of Two Earthquakes Nearly Identical
